title: System doesn't let upload a uvl file
body:
## Description:
The `fakenodo` module is not functioning properly in the production environment, throwing a connection error when accessing the `/zenodo/test` endpoint.

## Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a console
2. Run the application
3.  Try to create a dataset
4. Upload a UVL file

## Expected Behavior:
The service should leave the user upload a uvl file

## Observed Behavior:
The service doesn't work as it should and indicates that the uvl file is not valid

## Priority:
**High**

*Justification*: This issue directly impacts in the correct opearation of the platform

## Urgency:
**Critical**

*Justification*: This is a blocking issue that prevents the use of the module in the production environment, affecting project timelines.

title: Migration doesn't work right
body:
## Description:
The `flask db migrate` command fails due to multiple heads in Alembic and an issue where migration revisions are not being found.

## Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a console and navigate to the project directory.
2. Run the following command to initialize the database migration:
```bash
flask db migrate
```
3. Observe the error in the terminal output.

## Expected Behavior:
The flask db migrate command should detect schema changes and generate a new migration file without issues.

## Observed Behavior:
An error occurs indicating there are multiple heads in Alembic, and it cannot locate specific migration revisions.

## Priority:
**High**

*Justification*: This issue blocks database schema migrations, preventing further development and deployment of features that depend on database changes.

## Urgency:
**Critical**

*Justification*: The inability to migrate the database schema halts project progress and can introduce inconsistencies in the development and production environments.

title: fix: Change download all datasets feature
body:
## Description
The download all datasets feature currently downloads every dataset in uvlhub. After the implementation of the staging area feature, there are now some datasets that are unpublished and should only be accessible to certain users, so they should not be included included in the zip when downloading all datasets.

## Priority
**High**

*Justification*: This issue in the download all datasets feature clashes with the purpose of the staging area.

## Urgency
**Critical**

*Justification*: Makes some datasets accessible to users that should not be allowed to access to that information.

title: Build Tests from the Stagging Area WI fail
body:
## Description:
In the pull request related to the Staging Area WI, the checks related to the unit testing fail, the thing is that it only appears to give that outcome if the application isn't running, so in the local environment, all unit tests pass.



## Steps to Reproduce:
1. Go to GitHub
2. Check the pull requests
3. Wait to see the  performed actions results
4. check that the 2 build tests return errors

## Expected Behavior:
The tests should pass

## Observed Behavior:
The tests fail in the build of the pull request, while in local all tests passed

## Priority:
**High**

*Justification*: This issue blocks the continuation of the proccess of integrating the changes made in the WI to the master branch

## Urgency:
**Critical**

*Justification*: This is a blocking issue that prevents the use of the module in the production environment, affecting project timelines.

## Additional information:
Not needed

title: fix: Download all datasets button missed
body:
Download all datasets button now appear for logged and not logged users.

Closes #29

title: Download all datasets button missed
body:
## Description:

The "Download All Datasets" button is not visible to users who are logged in. This prevents authenticated users from accessing the bulk download feature for datasets, hindering their ability to efficiently obtain all available data.

## Steps to Reproduce:

- Log in to the application with valid user credentials.
- Navigate to the home page
- Look for the "Download All Datasets" button.
- Observe that the button is missing.

## Expected Behavior:

Authenticated users should see the "Download All Datasets" button, allowing them to download all available datasets in a single action for convenience and efficiency.

## Observed Behavior:

The "Download All Datasets" button does not appear for logged-in users, forcing them to download datasets individually, which is time-consuming and inefficient.

## Priority:

Medium

Justification: While the absence of the bulk download button impacts user experience and efficiency, users can still access and download individual datasets. This issue affects productivity but does not completely block access to the datasets.

## Urgency:

High

Justification: Enhancing the user experience by providing bulk download functionality is important for maintaining user satisfaction and productivity. Resolving this issue will streamline the data retrieval process for authenticated users.

## Additional Information:

![imagen](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/61a407c2-ea88-4c67-a679-694c9a6fd630)

## Suggested Fix:
- Review the frontend code to ensure the "Download All Datasets" button is rendered for authenticated users.

title: Feat/stagging area
body:
Added a Stagging area where the users will be able to leave their datasets before publishing to Zenodo (Fakenodo in our case), said datasets wont be able to be seen by others users in the platform as them are not published. Once the dataset is published, it status is updated and a DOI is assigned to them.
The functionality has been tested with unit and interface tests, as well as locust testing.

title: test: Datasets Module Testing

labels.name: test
labels.description: Creation of tests for improving coverage

body:
# Datasets Module Testing
## Description

As a developer, I want to implement comprehensive tests for the datasets module to increase code coverage. This will ensure that the module functions correctly across various scenarios and improve the overall reliability of the application.

## Acceptance Criteria

-  Edge Cases: Include tests for edge cases and potential error conditions within the datasets module.
-  CI Integration: Ensure that all new tests pass in the continuous integration pipeline without introducing failures.

## Priority:
**Low**

*Justification*: The realization of these tests won't affect the correct functionality of any test case or WI

## Urgency:
**Low**

*Justification*: We don't need to rush this issue, we are testing to improve the coverage of the dataset module, that has been tested in others WI

title: chore: Rename Docker images in Docker compose files
body:
## Description

To ensure consistency and maintainability across the project, rename the Docker images specified in the Docker Compose files. 

## Acceptance criteria

- All Docker Compose files in the repository are identified and updated with the new image names.
- Docker Compose files are validated to ensure they are free of syntax errors after renaming.
- Services and networks defined in the Docker Compose files start correctly using the renamed images.
- The changes do not disrupt existing development or deployment workflows.

## Priority

**Low**

_Justification_: Renaming Docker images is not time-sensitive but contributes to maintaining consistency within the project's naming conventions.

title: chore: Add emails to mailmap
body:
# Add Emails to Mailmap

## Description

To homogenize commit author names and emails, add entries to the mailmap file. This ensures consistent author information across all commits in the repository.

## Acceptance Criteria

- A `mailmap` file is created or updated in the repository.
- All relevant email addresses and author names are mapped to their canonical forms in the `mailmap`.
- Commit histories reflect the homogenized author information when using Git commands that utilize the `mailmap`.
- The `mailmap` mappings cover all existing variations of author names and emails in the commit history.
- Future commits by the authors are automatically mapped to the canonical names and emails as defined in the `mailmap`.

## Priority

**Low**
_Justification:_ The functionality has been studied and no critical risks have been found.

## Urgency:
**Medium**
*Justification* The functionality will help in the management of the commits, the sooner the implementation, the sooner we will see the results

title: Wrong title in user profile
body:
## Description:
The user page doesn't show the correct title when navigating to the current user's profile via putting their id

## Steps to Reproduce:
1. Start the project
2. Log in with an user
3. Check the current user's Id ( we will call it X from now on )
4. Navigate using the /profile/summary/X
5. You can now see how the title refers to "User Profile"

## Expected Behavior:
The service should respond correctly, showing the correct title (My Profile)

## Observed Behavior:
The system shows "User Profile" instead of "My Profile"

## Priority:
**Low**

*Justification*: This issue doesn't affect the correct behaviour of the system, its a merely aesthetic issue

## Urgency:
**Low**

*Justification*: This issue only affects an specific case, even then, the system still works fine, only showing a wrong comment

## Additional information:
 No extra information is needed

title: Connection Error in the fakenodo Module in Production Environment
body:
## Description:
The `fakenodo` module is not functioning properly in the production environment, throwing a connection error when accessing the `/zenodo/test` endpoint.

## Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a console
2. Navigate to the `/docker` file in the project.
3.  Run the following command:
```bash
sudo docker compose -f docker.compose.dev.yml
```
4. Once the service starts, access the URL provided in the system logs.
5. Navigate to the `/zenodo/test` path

## Expected Behavior:
The service should respond correctly, allowing the tests to be carried out at the `/zenodo/test` endpoint.

## Observed Behavior:
A `Connection refused` error occurs when attempting to access the mentioned URL.

## Priority:
**High**

*Justification*: This issue directly impacts in the production environment, halting the development and validation of features related to `fakenodo`.

## Urgency:
**Critical**

*Justification*: This is a blocking issue that prevents the use of the module in the production environment, affecting project timelines.

## Additional information:

### Error Screenshot

![connectionError](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1e2fdf07-7946-4f09-9518-aaa0b3fa08f8)

title: chore: Configure continuous integration and deployment
body:
# Configure Continuous Integration and Deployment

## Description

Set up CI/CD pipelines to automate testing and deployment for the project, ensuring code changes are reliably tested and deployed with minimal manual intervention.

## Acceptance Criteria

- CI/CD pipelines are configured to automate the testing process for every code change.
- CI/CD pipelines are configured to automate the deployment process after successful tests.
- The automation ensures that code changes are reliably tested and deployed with minimal manual intervention.

## Priority:
**High**
*Justification* Continuous integration is essential in the development of this project, so the implementation of these pipelines are a top priority

## Urgency:
**HIgh**
*Justification* We need the CI pipelines the earlier we can, so we can start applying it

## Description
As a user, I want to be able to click on a user's profile to view their uploaded datasets.

## Acceptance Criteria
- The user should be able to see another user's profile by clicking on the name of them in the dataset details
- The user should have some type of visual clue that represents if the profile that's seeing is their's or another's

## Priority:
**Low**
*Justification* This WI doesn't require a complex change so it can be placed in the lowest priority. If a High or Medium WI sounds complex as a first dive into the project, this issue is a good place to start

## Urgency:
**Low**
*Justification* This issue is a isolated functionality that is not related to any other WI

title: feat: Rate datasets
body:
# Issue: Rate datasets

## Description
As a user, I would like to be able to rate the datasets in this repository. This feature would help provide feedback on the quality, usability, and relevance of the datasets, allowing other users to make more informed decisions when choosing which resources to use.

## Acceptance Criteria
  - Users can rate each dataset with a star.
  - Ratings should be visible on the respective dataset page.
  - Users should only be able to rate once per dataset.
  - A way to clear ratings should be available for users who wish to change their review.

## Priority:
**Medium**
*Justification* This issue isn't a Hard WI, so in the priority charts, it goes right after the development of the Hard WI's

## Urgency:
**Low**
*Justification* This issue doesn't affect the development of the remaining WI's, also, being a Medium WI implies that there is more relevant work

title: feat: Download all datasets
body:
# Add 'Download All' Button for All Datasets

## Description

As a user, I want a 'Download All' button somewhere that downloads ALL datasets with ALL models and in ALL formats.

## Acceptance Criteria

- A 'Download All' button is added to the user interface in a visible and accessible location.
- Clicking the button initiates the download of all available datasets.
- All models associated with each dataset are included in the downloads.
- Datasets are available in all formats supported by the application.

## Priority:
**Medium**
*Justification* This needs to be done, but isn't a Hard WI, so in the priority charts, it goes right after the development of the Hard WI's

## Urgency:
**Low**
*Justification* This issue doesn't affect the development of the remaining WI's, also, being a Medium WI implies that there is more relevant work

title: feat: Staging area
body:
# Issue: Stagging Area

## Description
As a user, I want to be able to upload datasets to UVLHub without the need for them to be uploaded to Zenodo, that is, keep them in an "unpublished" state that allows me to edit them before they are permanently uploaded.
The operation of this functionality will consist of a button that will allow me to upload the datasets already created to Zenodo; the new datasets created will enter this state or stage area by default. The status of said dataset can be seen by the user on the information screen as if it were another attribute.

## Acceptance Criteria
  - The  user should be able to publish the dataset using the button implemented in the page
  - Published dataset shouldn't be able to be updated to reset the status to unpublished
    
## Priority:
**Medium**
*Justification* The functionality has been studied and no critical risks have been found, so the priority is set to medium difficulty, taking into account the difficulty assigned to the WI.

## Urgency:
**Medium**
*Justification* The functionality needs to be done and reviewed, because the complexity of the issue ( a High difficulty WI) this proccess may take a while.

title: feat: UVL editor
body:
# Issue: UVL editor

## Description
As a user, I want to have a UVL (Universal Variability Language) editor in graphical mode that allows users to visually edit UVL structures in order to export them or pass them to a parser for further processing. 

## Acceptance Criteria
  - The editor should allow users to edit the designed models uploaded by them.
  - Users should be able to save, load, and edit their UVL designs.

## Priority:
**High**
*Justification* This issue is one of the Hard WI, so it needs to be prioritized from the rest of WI's

## Urgency:
**Medium**
*Justification* Although this issue is related to a Hard WI, the functionality doesn't affect another WI, so we can prioritize quality over speed

title: feat: Fakenodo
body:
# Issue:  Fakenodo

## Description
As a developer, I want a "Fakenodo" module that mocks the Zenodo API to avoid interacting with the real Zenodo API during testing. This will prevent unnecessary data from being introduced into the Zenodo database and allow for safe, controlled testing without the risk of polluting the actual Zenodo environment with garbage or test data.

## Acceptance Criteria
  - Create a "Fakenodo" module that replicates the core functionalities of the Zenodo API for testing purposes.
  - The module should provide mock responses for commonly used API calls (e.g., create a deposit, retrieve deposit, delete a deposit).
  
This issue has been assigned with the same category in urgency and priority, high, that's because is one of the core changes that needs to be done in the project, and it's a High difficulty WI

## Priority:
**High**
*Justification* This issue is one of the core changes that needs to be done in the project in order to keep the real API, Zenodo, outside all the tests and work done here

## Urgency:
**High**
*Justification* The sooner we have this issue, the sooner we can test the WI that are connected to Zenodo (ie: WI that needs a zenodo service)
